attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this accounting period.

element.name: FiscalYearRefId
element.desc: Fiscal year to which this accounting period belongs.

element.name: StartDate
element.desc: Start date of the accounting period.

element.name: EndDate
element.desc: End date of the accounting period.

element.name: AccountType
element.desc: Classification of budgetary account code summary

element.name: FundType
element.desc: Is the account a general or special account code designation?

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: State-assigned ID for the relative area in which the expenditure/revenue was used.

element.name: ExpenditureArea
element.desc: Relative area in which the expenditure was used.

element.name: Function
element.desc: Function break in account code for summarization.

element.name: Object
element.desc: Object break in account code for summarization.

element.name: InstructionalProgram
element.desc: Instructional program break in account code for summarization

element.name: SpecialAmountType
element.desc: With regard to regional/local education service agencies report of "special" account code information, the account code summarization can be classified as:

element.name: GLAmountType
element.desc: With regard to an account code grouping classified as a General Ledger account:

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: SIF object referenced by SIF_RefId.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID for this transaction. The application that owns this object is responsible for generating this unique ID.

element.name: AccountClass
element.desc: Classification of budgetary account code summary

element.name: FundBreakdown
element.desc: Fund breakdown of account code for summarization.

element.name: FunctionBreakdown
element.desc: Function breakdown of account code for summarization.

element.name: ObjectBreakdown
element.desc: Object breakdown of account code for summarization.

element.name: BudgetAmount
element.desc: Summarized, positive amount without cents for breakdowns

value.name: ANNUAL_YEAR
value.desc: Annual year

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies a particular HR staff assignment.

attribute.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
attribute.desc: This GUID referencing the parent EmployeePersonal object

element.name: PrimaryAssignment
element.desc: Is this the staff member's primary assignment? There must be one and only one instance of the object with Yes in this value per school year.

element.name: LocationInfoRefId
element.desc: This is an optional element so the placement of the employee within the agency can be tracked as needed. The GUID references the LocationInfo object.

element.name: JobStartDate
element.desc: This is the date from which the staff assignment is valid (inclusive).

element.name: JobEndDate
element.desc: This is the date through which the staff assignment is valid (inclusive). Present if the JobStartDate is entered and a JobEndDate is available.

element.name: JobFTE
element.desc: Full-time job equivalent ratio for this assignment. (Format is x.xx; an employee who is full-time and who spends 50% of their time on this assignment would be represented as 0.50)

element.name: JobClassification
element.desc: The specific group of duties or responsibilities of position.

element.name: ProgramType
element.desc: The type of instructional or non-instructional program.

element.name: FundingSource
element.desc: Provider of funds for the program or service.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID of the employee contract information.

attribute.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that refers to the EmployeePersonal object.

element.name: BaseSalary
element.desc: Base salary of employee for this contact in whole dollars

element.name: ContractDays
element.desc: Number of days in service for contract total

element.name: AssignmentDays
element.desc: Number of days per year employee is expected to work in this assignment

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that uniquely identifies this employee.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: The state-assigned identifier for this staff member.

element.name: OtherIdList
element.desc: This field can hold SSN, state and locally assigned IDs.

element.name: Demographics
element.desc: This element contains information related to employee demographics.

attribute.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
attribute.desc: This is the GUID of the Employee whose picture this is.

element.name: PictureSource
element.desc: This element defines the picture. If the Type attribute is URL, this is the location of the picture in [JPEG] format; if Type is JPEG, this is the [JPEG] image data encoded using the Base64 Content-Transfer-Encoding defined in Section 6.8 of [RFC 2045].

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID of the employee's pay information.

attribute.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The GUID that refers to the EmployeePersonal object.

object.name: EmploymentRecord
object.desc: This object contains a snapshot (view) of employment information for an employee.

attribute.name: SIF_RefId
attribute.desc: The GUID can either refer to the EmployeePersonal or StaffPersonal object.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: The GUID reference to the LEAInfo object representing the LEA that employs the staff member.

element.name: Active
element.desc: Staff is currently active and/or employed.

element.name: TerminationDate
element.desc: Date the employee resigned. Present if a HireDate is entered and a TerminationDate is available.

element.name: TotalYearsExperience
element.desc: Total number of years of prior experience.

element.name: PositionNumber
element.desc: Employee's level or category assigned by employer.

element.name: AccountCode
element.desc: Account code charged to this item.

attribute.name: Code
attribute.desc: The type tax ID that this is. TIN based on IRS Publication 1915 [IRSTIN].

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this financial account.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this object.

element.name: ReportDate
element.desc: Date on which snapshot was generated.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: State assigned reporting ID for district or agency

element.name: ReportDate
element.desc: Date on which snapshot was generated.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this financial class.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this income statement.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this financial transaction.

attribute.name: FinancialAccountAccountingPeriodLocationInfoRefId
attribute.desc: FinancialAccountAccountingPeriodLocationInfo reference.

attribute.name: FinancialClassRefId
attribute.desc: Class of the financial account.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID that identifies this object.

element.name: Description
element.desc: A description of the fiscal year.

element.name: StartDate
element.desc: Start date of the fiscal year.

element.name: EndDate
element.desc: End date of the fiscal year.

value.name: PO
value.desc: Purchase order

attribute.name: FinancialAccountAccountingPeriodLocationInfoRefId
attribute.desc: Account.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: Values: Debit, Credit

attribute.name: Currency
attribute.desc: Currency code. Where omitted, defaults to implementation-defined local currency, typically USD in the United States.

value.name: CURRICULUM_DEVELOPMENT
value.desc: Curriculum Development and Improvement

value.name: EDUCATION_PLANNING
value.desc: Education Planning

value.name: INSTRUCTIONAL_MATERIALS
value.desc: Instructional Materials

value.name: CONTINUING_EDUCATION
value.desc: Continuing Education

value.name: PUPIL_PERSONNEL
value.desc: Pupil Personnel

value.name: STATE_AND_FEDERAL_LIAISON
value.desc: State and Federal Liaison

value.name: MEDICAL_ASSISTANCE
value.desc: Medical Assistance

value.name: AUXILIARY_SERVICES
value.desc: Auxiliary services of non-profit private and parochial schools

element.name: OtherId
element.desc: List all "other" IDs associated with employee.

object.name: HRProgramType
object.desc: The specific group of duties or responsibilities of position.

object.name: JobClassification
object.desc: The specific group of duties or responsibilities of position.

value.name: OFFICIAL_ADMINISTRATIVE
value.desc: Official-administrative—Performs management activities that require developing broad policies and executing those policies through direction of individuals at all levels. This includes high-level administrative activities performed directly for policy makers.

value.name: ADMINISTRATIVE_SUPERVISORY
value.desc: Administrative/supervisory/ancillary services officer—Performs professional management, administrative, research, analytical, supervisory, and/or ancillary services for a senior executive. This includes personnel responsible for services such as evaluation, teacher development, dissemination, curriculum development, admissions and recruitment, marketing and development.

value.name: BOARD_OF_EDUCATION_SCHOOL_BOAR
value.desc: Board of education/school board/board of trustees member—Performs activities as a member of a legally constituted body which has been created and vested with responsibilities for educational policy- and decision-making as specified in education codes and regulations in a given geographical area.

value.name: COMMANDANT_OF_CADETS
value.desc: Commandant of cadets—Performs executive management functions of the cadet corps, and is responsible for cadet promotions, leadership training, and the system utilized by the institution to maintain and administer disciplinary measures to promote order and decorum.

value.name: DEAN_DEAN_OF_INSTRUCTIONS_DEAN
value.desc: Dean/dean of instructions/dean of students/dean of boys/dean of girls/dean of student activities—Oversees either academic/curriculum activities, or, student body activities and behaviors such as student government, school club, rally and assembly.

value.name: DEPUTY_ASSOCIATE_VICE-_ASSISTA
value.desc: Deputy/associate/vice-/assistant principal—Performs high-level executive management functions in an individual school, group of schools, or units of a school system. Primary duties include but are not limited to: 1) supervising student behavior; 2) handling specific assigned duties related to school management; 3) continuing curriculum and staff development; 4) working cooperatively with professional staff; 5) providing leadership in the instructional program; and 6) coordinating and/or arranging class schedule.

value.name: DEPUTY_ASSOCIATE_ASSISTANT_SUP
value.desc: Deputy/associate/assistant superintendent/ commissioner—Performs high-level executive management functions for a superintendent in the areas of personnel, instruction, and/or administration such as business, transportation, food services, maintenance, operation, facility management/planning, and others. Such an assignment also includes performing the duties of the superintendent in his or her absence as assigned or designated.

value.name: EXECUTIVE_ASSISTANT-PERFORMS_P
value.desc: Executive assistant-Performs professional activities assisting an executive officer in directing and managing the functions of a school or system.

value.name: INSTRUCTIONAL_PROGRAM_DIRECTOR
value.desc: Instructional program director/coordinator/consultant—Coordinates, manages (including supervising other certified individuals), or directs activities and/or services (e.g., vocational education and special education) within an instructional program or area of instruction.

value.name: MANAGER
value.desc: Manager—Directs individuals and manages functional supporting services (e.g., financial aid) under the direction of a senior staff member. This includes directors/managers of purchasing agents, physical plant maintenance, management information and technology services, business managers, budget managers, and psychological services.

value.name: NON-INSTRUCTIONAL_PROGRAM_DIR
value.desc: Non-instructional program director/coordinator/consultant—Coordinates, manages (including supervising other certified individuals), or directs activities and/or services within a non-instructional program.

value.name: OMBUDSPERSON
value.desc: Ombudsperson—Receives and investigates complaints made by individuals against alleged abuses resulting from capricious acts by administrative officials. The ombudsman usually works for the board of education in a quasi-official status.

value.name: PRINCIPAL_HEADMASTER_HEADMISTRESS
value.desc: Principal/headmaster/headmistress/head of school—Performs the highest level of executive management functions in an individual school, a group of schools, or units of a school system. Responsibilities include the administration of instructional programs, extracurricular programs, community relations, operation of the school plant, selection and evaluation of professional and support staff, and the coordination of staff and student activities.

value.name: SCHOOL_PRESIDENT
value.desc: School president—Implements short and long-range plans; performs recruitment, community relations, fund-raising, and other external functions; in some cases, supervises principal and establishes institutional operation philosophy to follow Board policy.

value.name: SCHOOL_SITE_COUNCIL_MEMBER
value.desc: School site council member—Performs activities as a member of an advis ory body which has been created by state legislation to provide for an individual school advice/support on various school activities such as fund spending on a particular program.

value.name: SUPERINTENDENT_COMMISSIONER
value.desc: Superintendent/commissioner—Serves as the chief executive officer and primary advisor to the board of education. Responsibilities include overseeing the development of educational programs and all other activities which impact on those programs.

value.name: PROFESSIONAL-EDUCATIONAL
value.desc: Professional-educational—Performs duties requiring a high degree of knowledge and skills generally acquired through at least a baccalaureate degree (or its equivalent obtained through special study and/or experience) including skills in the field of education, educational psychology, educational social work, or an education therapy field.

value.name: ATHLETIC_COACH
value.desc: Athletic coach—Instructs individuals in the fundamentals of a competitive sport and direct team or individual strategy.

value.name: BEHAVIORAL_MANAGEMENT_SPECIALIST
value.desc: Behavioral management specialist—Performs analysis of students' inappropriate behaviors, devises interventions to change such behaviors, and monitors behavior improvement progress overtime.

value.name: COUNSELOR
value.desc: Counselor—Guides individuals, families, groups, and ommunities by assisting them in problem-solving, decision-making, discovering meaning, and articulating goals related to personal, educational, and career development.

value.name: CURRICULUM_SPECIALIST
value.desc: Curriculum specialist—Develops or supervises curriculum and instructional development activities. This assignment requires expertise in a specialized field and includes the curriculum consultant and curriculum supervisor.

value.name: EDUCATION_DIAGNOSTICIAN
value.desc: Education diagnostician—Diagnoses students who might need special education services and/or other educational interventions.

value.name: LIBRARIAN_MEDIA_CONSULTANT
value.desc: Librarian/media consultant—Develops plans for and manage the use of teaching and learning resources, including the maintenance of equipment, content material, services, multi-media, and information sources.

value.name: REMEDIAL_SPECIALIST
value.desc: Remedial specialist—Performs activities concerned with developing specific cognitive skills, usually in language arts or mathematics, from a deficient level to one that is appropriate to the educational abilities and aspirations of the student.

value.name: STUDENT_ACTIVITY_ADVISOR_NON-A
value.desc: Student activity advisor/non-athletic coach—Instructs individuals in the fundamentals of a non-athletic activity and develops training and competition schedules.

value.name: STUDENT_TEACHER
value.desc: Student teacher—Provides learning experiences and care to students under the supervision of a certified teacher as part of a formalized higher education program of teacher preparation.

value.name: TEACHER
value.desc: Teacher—Provides instruction, learning experiences, and care to students during a particular time period or in a given discipline.

value.name: TEACHER_TRAINER
value.desc: Teacher trainer—Provides instruction, learning experiences, and/or professional development activities to teachers during a particular time period or in a given discipline.

value.name: TEACHING_INTERN
value.desc: Teaching intern—Provides instruction, learning experiences, and care to students while obtaining the necessary knowledge and skills in education and/or educational psychology.

value.name: RESOURCE_TEACHER
value.desc: Resource teacher—Assists a classroom teacher by providing services to enrich the instruction of the students with special education needs.

value.name: PROFESSIONAL-OTHER
value.desc: Professional-other—Performs assignments requiring a high degree of knowledge and skills usually acquired through at least a baccalaureate degree (or its equivalent obtained through special study and/or experience) but not necessarily requiring skills in the field of education.

value.name: ACCOUNTANT
value.desc: Accountant—Designs and maintains financial, staff, student, program, or property records; summarizes, analyzes, audits, or verifies such records; and/or controls and certifies expenditures and receipts.

value.name: ACCREDITATION_OFFICER
value.desc: Accreditation officer—Reviews and evaluates an organizational unit to certify the observation of legal requirements or prescribed standards for the operation of such units.

value.name: ADMINISTRATIVE_INTERN
value.desc: Administrative intern—Performs administrative activities as part of a formal training program requiring supervision and periodic evaluation.

value.name: ADMISSIONS_OFFICER
value.desc: Admissions officer—Examines academic records of students to determine eligibility for graduation or for entrance to school.

value.name: ANALYST
value.desc: Analyst—Examines, evaluates, and makes recommendations in such areas as cost, systems, curriculum, educational sectors, or other areas including management, research and assessment, policy, budget, and personnel.

value.name: ARCHITECT
value.desc: Architect—Performs activities such as designing and preparing plans and specifications for the construction, remodeling, or repair of buildings and facilities, modification of site, and overseeing the construction to ensure compliance with plans and specifications.

value.name: ATHLETIC_TRAINER
value.desc: Athletic trainer—Coordinates and implements training activities for athletes to improve their athletic performance.

value.name: ATTENDANCE_OFFICER
value.desc: Attendance officer—Monitors compulsory attendance laws.

value.name: AUDIOLOGIST
value.desc: Audiologist—Provides services including: 1) identification of individuals with hearing loss; 2) determination of the range, nature, and degree of hearing loss, including referral for medical or other professional attention; 3) provision of habilitating activities such as language habilitation, auditory training, speech reading (lip-reading), hearing evaluation, and speech conservation; 4) creation and administration of programs for prevention of hearing loss; 5) counseling and guidance of students, parent/guardians, and teachers regarding hearing loss; and 6) determination of an individual's need for group and individual amplification, selecting and fitting an appropriate aid, and evaluating the effectiveness of amplification.

value.name: AUDITOR
value.desc: Auditor—Performs activities concerned with examining, verifying, and reporting on accounting records.

value.name: BENEFITS_SPECIALIST
value.desc: Benefits specialist—Organizes and provides information to employees about organizational fringe benefits.

value.name: CAMPUS_MINISTER_CHAPLAIN
value.desc: Campus minister/chaplain (clergy or layperson)—Performs religious functions in a school.

value.name: CASEWORKER
value.desc: Caseworker—Counsels and aids individuals and families requiring assistance of social service agencies and secures information on factors contributing to a clients situation. Counsels clients regarding plans for meeting needs and aids clients in mobilizing capacities and environmental resources to improve social functioning.

value.name: COMPUTER_PROGRAMMER
value.desc: Computer programmer—Prepares sets of instructions for a computer, based on project specifications, in order to solve problems.

value.name: COMPUTER_SYSTEMS_ANALYST
value.desc: Computer systems analyst—Analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems in processing or to improve and/or modify an existing computer system.

value.name: CURATOR_AND_ARCHIVIST
value.desc: Curator and archivist—Collects, classifies, preserves, and exhibits objects of interest in such fields as science, literature, history and art.

value.name: DENTAL_HYGIENIST
value.desc: Dental hygienist—Performs dental prophylactic treatments and instructs patients in the care of the teeth and mouth.

value.name: DENTIST
value.desc: Dentist—Diagnoses and treats diseases, injuries, and malformations of the teeth and gums.

value.name: DIETITIAN_NUTRITIONIST
value.desc: Dietitian/nutritionist—Plans and directs food service menu preparation including determining the nutritional value of food for meals.

value.name: ENGINEER
value.desc: Engineer—Applies scientific and mathematical principles to practical ends such as the design, construction, and operation of efficient and economical structures, equipment, and systems.

value.name: EVALUATOR
value.desc: Evaluator—Determines the value or effect of plans, programs, and activities by appraisal of data and activities in light of specified goals and objectives (e.g. personnel evaluator).

value.name: FAMILY_COMMUNITY_SUPPORT_COORD
value.desc: Family/community support coordinator—Fosters ties between the school, the family, and/or community by conducting services such as family education, the integration of community services, and/or direct intervention as needed.

value.name: FINANCIAL_AID_OFFICER
value.desc: Financial aid officer—Reviews and assesses student applications for financial aid programs such as loans, grants-in-aid, or scholarships, in order to make determinations concerning assistance.

value.name: FUNCTIONAL_APPLICATION_SUPPORT
value.desc: Functional application support specialist—Assists individual computer users in a mini- or micro-computer [e.g., personal computer (PC)] environment to resolve hardware and software issues.

value.name: GRANT_DEVELOPER
value.desc: Grant developer—Expands opportunities to obtain funds from outside parties in exchange for completion of a task.

value.name: HISTORIAN
value.desc: Historian—Prepares a chronological account or record of past or current events dealing with some phase of human activity, either in terms of individuals, social, ethnic, political, or geographic groupings.

value.name: INTERNAL_AUDITOR
value.desc: Internal auditor—Verifies account records, including evaluating the adequacy of the internal control system, verifying and safeguarding assets, reviewing the reliability of the accounting and reporting systems, and ascertaining compliance with established policies and procedures.

value.name: INTERPRETER
value.desc: Interpreter—Translates consecutively or instantaneously from one language into another language using spoken and/or manual words (e.g., sign language interpreter).

value.name: LAWYER
value.desc: Lawyer—Practices law and performs such activities as conducting lawsuits, drawing up legal documents, and advising on legal rights.

value.name: LEGISLATIVE_LIAISON
value.desc: Legislative liaison—Coordinates with the legislature in the preparation of legislation, provides information to legislative committees and members, and testifies before such bodies.

value.name: NEGOTIATOR
value.desc: Negotiator—Performs such activities as resolving labor/management problems and helping to settle disputes and effect compromises. This includes representatives of either management or labor (e.g., shop stewards).

value.name: NETWORK_ADMINISTRATOR
value.desc: Network administrator—Coordinates the inputs, outputs, and use of computer networks (e.g., local area networks (LAN) and wide area networks (WAN)).

value.name: NURSE_PRACTITIONER
value.desc: Nurse Practitioner—Performs the functions of a registered nurse either independently, or dependently with a written agreement of a medical doctor.

value.name: OCCUPATIONAL_THERAPIST
value.desc: Occupational therapist—Provides services that address the functional needs of an individual related to the following: 1) improving developing or restoring functions impaired or lost through illness, injury, or deprivation; 2) improving ability to perform tasks for independent functioning when functions are impaired or lost; 3) preventing through early intervention, initial or further impairment or loss of function. The provider of these services is a certified, licensed, or otherwise qualified individual.

value.name: OPHTHALMOLOGIST
value.desc: Ophthalmologist—Provides specialized services in the care of the eye and its related structures.

value.name: OPTOMETRIST
value.desc: Optometrist—Treats optical and muscle defects of the eye without the use of drugs or surgery.

value.name: PERSONNEL_OFFICER_SPECIALIST
value.desc: Personnel officer/specialist—Performs activities concerned with staff recruitment, selection, training, and assignment. This includes maintaining staff records, working with administrators in developing pension and insurance plans, and maintaining employer-employee harmony and efficiency through negotiations and internal public relations efforts.

value.name: PHYSICAL_THERAPIST
value.desc: Physical therapist—Facilitates remediation and compensation for deficits in foundation skills necessary for classroom and/or basic job performance, particular areas of emphasis include gross motor skills, functional mobility and gait, musculoskeletal alignment, strength, endurance, and positioning. Typical responsibilities include: screening, evaluation, and assessment of children to identify movement dysfunction; obtaining, interpreting, and integrating information appropriate to program planning, to prevent or alleviate movement dysfunction and related functional problems; and providing individual and group services to treatment to prevent, alleviate, or compensate for movement dysfunction and related functional problems. The provider of these services is a licensed, certified, or otherwise qualified professional.

value.name: PHYSICIAN
value.desc: Physician—Diagnoses and treats diseases and disorders of the human body.

value.name: PHYSICIAN_ASSISTANT
value.desc: Physician assistant—Provides health care services to patients under the direction and responsibility of a physician.

value.name: PLANNING_SPECIALIST
value.desc: Planning specialist—Performs activities concerned with selecting or identifying the goals, priorities, objectives, and projected trends of an organization and formulating the courses of action necessary to fulfill these objectives.

value.name: PSYCHIATRIST
value.desc: Psychiatrist—Diagnoses and treats diseases and disorders of the mind.

value.name: PSYCHOLOGIST
value.desc: Psychologist—Evaluates and analyzes students' behavior by measuring and interpreting their intellectual, emotional, and social development, and diagnosing their educational and personal problems.

value.name: PUBLIC_RELATIONS_INFORMATIONAL
value.desc: Public relations/informational services officer—Attempts to foster good relations between an organization and the public as a whole, by planning and conducting programs to disseminate accurate information through such media as newspapers, radio and television, public forums, and civic activities, and by reviewing material for and directing preparation of publications.

value.name: RECREATIONAL_THERAPIST
value.desc: Recreational therapist—Plans, organizes, and directs medically -approved recreation programs for patients. Activities include sports, trips, dramatics, social activities, and arts and crafts.

value.name: RECREATION_WORKER
value.desc: Recreation worker—Conducts group recreation activities; organizes and promotes activities such as arts and crafts, sports, games, music, dramatics, social recreation, camping, and hobbies, taking into account the needs and interests of individual members.

value.name: REGISTERED_NURSE
value.desc: Registered nurse—Conducts a health service program at a school or system for the evaluation, improvement and protection of the health of students and school personnel in accordance with state law and local policies and procedures.

value.name: REGISTRAR
value.desc: Registrar—Coordinates and directs registration activities, including the compilation and analysis of registration data for administrative use.

value.name: REHABILITATION_COUNSELOR
value.desc: Rehabilitation counselor—Provides services in individual or group sessions that focus specifically on career development, employment preparation, achieving independence, and integration in the workplace and community of a student with a disability. The provider of these services is a certified, license, or otherwise qualified professional. The term also includes vocational rehabilitation services provided to students with disabilities by vocational rehabilitation programs funded under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.

value.name: RESEARCH_AND_DEVELOPMENT_SPECI
value.desc: Research and development specialist—Performs activities concerned with systematic study and investigation using the products of research and judgement to improve programs.

value.name: RESPIRATORY_THERAPIST
value.desc: Respiratory therapist—Administers respiratory therapy care and life support to patients with deficiencies and abnormalities of the cardiopulmonary system, under the direction and responsibility of a physician.

value.name: SOCIAL_WORKER
value.desc: Social worker—Provides social services for clients who may be individuals, families, groups, communities, organizations, or society in general. Typical responsibilities include: 1) preparing a social or developmental history on a student with disabilities; 2) group and individual counseling with a student and his or her family; 3) working with those problems in a student’s living situation (home, school, and community) that affect adjustment in school; 4) mobilizing school and community resources in order to enable the student to receive maximum benefit from his or her educational program; and 5) other related services as necessary. The provider of these services are certified, licensed, or otherwise qualified professionals.

value.name: SPEECH_PATHOLOGIST_THERAPIST
value.desc: Speech pathologist/therapist—Diagnoses communicative disorders, plans, directs and participates in individual or group therapy sessions which focus on the remediation of specific articulation problems including: 1) identification of children with speech or language impairments; 2) diagnosis and appraisal of specific speech or language impairments; 3) referral for medical or other professional attention necessary for the habilitation of speech or language impairments; 4) provision of speech and language services for the habilitation or prevention of communicative impairments; and 5) counseling and guidance of parents, children, and teachers regarding speech and language requirements. The provider of these services are certified, licensed, or otherwise qualified professionals.

value.name: STAFF_DEVELOPER_TEACHER_TRAINE
value.desc: Staff developer/teacher trainer—Plans, coordinates, and implements inservice training activities that help individuals to identify future career options and improve skills necessary to achieve them.

value.name: STATISTICIAN
value.desc: Statistician—Plans surveys and collects, summarizes, and interprets numerical data, applying statistical theory and methods to provide usable information.

value.name: STUDENT_PERSONNEL_OFFICER
value.desc: Student personnel officer—Works with the family, school, and community to determine the cause of and provide solutions for students who are experiencing serious attendance, academic and/or discipline problems in order to promote positive educational development.

value.name: TAX_ASSESSOR_COLLECTOR
value.desc: Tax assessor/collector—Provides services in the assessment of real and personal property for tax computation purposes and in the collection of taxes for the school or system.

value.name: TRANSITION_COORDINATOR
value.desc: Transition coordinator—Provides services that: 1) strengthen and coordinate special programs and related services for individuals with special needs, including students with disabilities, who are currently in school or have recently left school and may benefit from assistance during the transition to postsecondary education, vocational training, competitive employment (including supported employment), continuing education or adult services; 2) stimulate the improvement and development of programs for secondary special education; and/or 3) stimulate the improvement of vocational and life skills to enable students with special needs to be better prepared for transition to adult life and services.

value.name: TRANSLATOR
value.desc: Translator—Expresses in another language systematically to retain the original sense, primarily of written works.

value.name: VOLUNTEER_COORDINATOR
value.desc: Volunteer coordinator—Oversees and coordinates the activity of individuals who enter into positions without the promise of compensation.

value.name: WORK_STUDY_COORDINATOR
value.desc: Work study coordinator—Plans and conducts special education work-study programs. He or she confers with school and community personnel to impart information about program and to coordinate program functions with related activities.

value.name: WRITER_EDITOR
value.desc: Writer/editor—Writes original prose materials and reviews manuscripts for distribution and/or publication.

value.name: MEDIATOR_INTERVENTION_SPECIALI
value.desc: Mediator/intervention specialist—Specializes in serving as a third party to help resolve disputes between individuals and/or organizations.

value.name: PARAPROFESSIONALS
value.desc: Paraprofessionals—Works alongside and assists professional individuals.

value.name: ASSISTANT_COUNSELOR
value.desc: Assistant counselor—Assists students, parents, teachers, or other staff, under the supervision or direction of a counselor, by helping individuals make plans and decisions in relation to education, career, or personal development.

value.name: BILINGUAL_AIDE
value.desc: Bilingual aide—Assists in the instruction of students using more than one language for teaching content.

value.name: BILINGUAL_SPECIAL_EDUCATION_AI
value.desc: Bilingual special education aide—Assists in the instruction of students in a special education program using more than one language for teaching content

value.name: CAREER_AIDE
value.desc: Career aide—Assists students in the process of choosing a profession or occupation.

value.name: CHILD_CARE_GIVER
value.desc: Child care giver—Assists in organizing and leading prekindergarten children in activities such as reading, drawing, and games.

value.name: COMPUTER_AIDE
value.desc: Computer aide—Assists and provides direction to computer users.

value.name: EXTRA_CURRICULAR_ACTIVITY_AIDE
value.desc: Extra-curricular activity aide—Supervises school-sponsored activities that are not related to curriculum (e.g., sports), including all direct and personal services that are planned for student enjoyment.

value.name: FINANCIAL_AID_SPECIALIST
value.desc: Financial aid specialist—Interviews students applying for financial aid, including loans, grants -in-aid, or scholarships, to determine eligibility for assistance.

value.name: MONITOR_PREFECT
value.desc: Monitor/prefect—Monitors the conduct of students in classrooms, detention halls, lunch rooms, playground, hallways, and places where alternatives to classroom instruction are provided (e.g., test sites).

value.name: LIBRARY_AIDE
value.desc: Library aide—Assists in the maintenance and operation of a library by aiding in the selection, ordering, cataloging, processing, and circulation of all media.

value.name: MEDIA_CENTER_AIDE
value.desc: Media center aide—Assists in the maintenance and operation of a media center by serving as a specialist in the organization and use of all teaching and learning resources, including hardware, content material and services.

value.name: PSYCHOLOGIST_ASSISTANT
value.desc: Psychologist assistant—Assists a psychologist with routine activities associated with providing psychological services.

value.name: TEACHING_CLASSROOM_AIDE
value.desc: Teaching/classroom aide—Assists a teacher with routine activities associated with teaching (i.e., those activities requiring minor decisions regarding students, such as conducting rote exercises, operating equipment, and clerking).

value.name: TEACHING_ASSISTANT
value.desc: Teaching assistant—Performs the day-to-day activities of teaching students while under the supervision of a teacher. The teaching assistant does not make diagnostic or long-range evaluative decisions regarding students. This includes individuals who may or may not be certified but must have completed at least two years of formal education preparation for teaching or the equivalent in experience or training.

value.name: TUTOR
value.desc: Tutor—Provides academic instruction (e.g., in English, mathematics, and foreign language) to students requiring additional assistance outside of the classroom.

value.name: TECHNICAL
value.desc: Technical—Performs tasks requiring a combination of basic scientific knowledge and manual skills which can be obtained through approximately two years of postsecondary education such as that which is offered in community/junior colleges and technical institutes, or through equivalent special study and/or on-the-job training.

value.name: AUDIOMETRIST
value.desc: Audiometrist—Administers audiometric (hearing acuity) screening tests while under the direction and responsibility of an audiologist or physician.

value.name: COMPUTER_TECHNICIAN
value.desc: Computer technician—Installs and maintains computer hard- and software equipment.

value.name: DRAFTER
value.desc: Drafter—Drafts detailed drawings, such as writing diagrams, layout drawings, mechanical detail drawings, and drawings of intermediate and final assemblies, used to manufacture, assemble, install, and repair electronic components, printed circuit boards, and other equipment.

value.name: ENGINEERING_AIDE
value.desc: Engineering aide—Assists in planning and directing operations in a technical field.

value.name: GRAPHIC_ARTIST
value.desc: Graphic artist—Plans and arranges art layouts which illustrate programs or processes for publication, demonstration, and more effective communication.

value.name: INSPECTOR
value.desc: Inspector—Examines the condition of equipment and buildings as they relate to safety and health the condition of new construction as it relates to specifications and codes.

value.name: LICENSED_PRACTICAL_NURSE
value.desc: Licensed practical nurse—Performs auxiliary medical services, such as taking and recording temperature, pulse, and respiration rate, and giving medication under the direction and responsibility of a physician or a registered nurse.

value.name: MEDIA_TECHNOLOGIST
value.desc: Media technologist—Maintains and programs audio, video, and other media equipment.

value.name: PHOTOGRAPHER
value.desc: Photographer—Uses cameras and flashbulb equipment to photograph individuals and may take exposed film to a darkroom for processing and developing.

value.name: PSYCHOMETRIST
value.desc: Psychometrist—Measures the intellectual, social, and emotional development of individuals through the administration and interpretation of psychological tests. These activities are usually carried out under the direction or supervis ion of a psychologist or a related professional.

value.name: PURCHASING_AGENT
value.desc: Purchasing agent—Buys supplies, equipment, and materials used in the operation of an organization.

value.name: SPEECH_LANGUAGE_TECHNICIAN
value.desc: Speech language technician—Assis ts with the provision of speech and language services in collaboration with a speech pathologist.

value.name: SUPERVISOR
value.desc: Supervisor—Supervises the day-to-day operations of a group of skilled, semiskilled, or unskilled workers (e.g., warehouse or garage workers). Frequently called a foreman or crew leader.

value.name: OFFICE_CLERICAL_ADMINISTRATIVE
value.desc: Office/clerical/administrative support—Performs the activities of preparing, transferring, transcribing, systematizing, or preserving communications, records, and transactions.

value.name: BOOKKEEPING_ACCOUNTING_AUDITIN
value.desc: Bookkeeping/accounting/auditing clerk—Keeps a systematic record of accounts or transactions and prepares statements reflecting those activities.

value.name: CASHIER
value.desc: Cashier—Collects and records payments received for items purchased.

value.name: COMPUTER_OPERATOR
value.desc: Computer operator—Operates computer and peripheral equipment to process data by entering commands using a keyboard or computer terminal.

value.name: DATA_ENTRY_CLERK
value.desc: Data entry clerk—Enters information into a data processing format using data processing equipment.

value.name: DISPATCHER
value.desc: Dispatcher—Assigns vehicles and drivers to perform specific services and to record such information concerning vehicle movement as a school or system may require.

value.name: DUPLICATING_PHOTOCOPYING_ASSIS
value.desc: Duplicating/photocopying assistant—Operates duplicating machines to print typewritten or handwritten documents directly from a master copy.

value.name: ELECTRICAL_AND_ELECTRONIC_REPA
value.desc: Electrical and electronic repairers—Installs and repairs electric and electronics equipment.

value.name: FILE_CLERK
value.desc: File clerk—Classifies records in alphabetical or numerical order or according to subject matter or other system.

value.name: GENERAL_OFFICE_CLERK
value.desc: General office clerk—Performs such activities as preparing, transcribing, systematizing or preserving written communication and reports or operating mechanical equipment (e.g., computers, fax machines, typewriters, calculators, and word-processing equipment).

value.name: MAIL_CLERK
value.desc: Mail clerk—Routes mail, prepares outgoing materials for mailing, and maintains internal written communication systems.

value.name: MESSENGER
value.desc: Messenger—Delivers messages, documents, packages, and other items to offices or departments within or outside of an organization.

value.name: OFFICE_MANAGER
value.desc: Office manager—Coordinates office services such as personnel, budget preparation and control, housekeeping, records control, and special management activities.

value.name: RECEPTIONIST
value.desc: Receptionist—Receives callers or visitors at the establishment, determine the nature of business, and directs callers or visitors to destinations.

value.name: RECORDS_CLERK
value.desc: Records clerk—Establishes and ma intains an adequate and efficient system for controlling records (e.g., registration, admission, attendance) of an organization.

value.name: SECRETARY
value.desc: Secretary—Schedules appointments, gives information to callers, takes dictation, and otherwise relieves officials of clerical work and minor administrative and business detail.

value.name: STENOGRAPHER
value.desc: Stenographer—Takes dictation of correspondence, reports, and other materials in shorthand and operates a typewriter, wordprocessor, or computer to transcribe the dictated material.

value.name: STORES_SUPPLIES_HANDLER
value.desc: Stores/supplies handler—Receives, stores, and dispenses supplies, materials, and equipment.

value.name: SWITCHBOARD_PBX_OPERATOR
value.desc: Switchboard/PBX operator—Operates a telephone switchboard and relays incoming, outgoing, and interoffice calls.

value.name: TYPIST_AND_WORDPROCESSOR
value.desc: Typist and wordprocessor—Operates a typewriter, computer or a wordprocessor to compile, type, revise, combine, edit, print, and/or store documents.

value.name: CRAFTS_AND_TRADES
value.desc: Crafts and trades—Performs tasks requiring high manual skill level which is acquired through on-the-job training and experience or through apprenticeship or other formal training programs. This assignment requires considerable judgement and a thorough and comprehensive knowledge of the processes involved in the work.

value.name: BRICK_MASON
value.desc: Brick mason—Works with brick and similar materials in the construction, erection, and reparation of structures and fixtures.

value.name: CARPENTER
value.desc: Carpenter—Constructs, erects, installs, and repairs wooden structures and fixtures.

value.name: CEMENT_MASON
value.desc: Cement mason—Works with cement and similar materials in the construction, erection, and reparation of structures and fixtures.

value.name: ELECTRICIAN
value.desc: Electrician—Plans, layouts, installs, and repairs wiring, electrical fixtures, apparatus, and control equipment.

value.name: HVAC_MECHANIC
value.desc: HVAC mechanic—Services heating units, ventilation systems and air conditioners in buildings.

value.name: LOCKSMITH
value.desc: Locksmith—Installs, repairs, rebuilds, and services mechanical or electrical locking devices using hand tools and specialized equipment.

value.name: MAINTENANCE_REPAIRERS_GENERAL_
value.desc: Maintenance repairers/general utility—Repairs and maintains buildings, machinery, electrical and mechanical equipment.

value.name: PAINTER_AND_PAPERHANGER
value.desc: Painter and paperhanger—Paints, varnishes, and stains or wallpaper the interior and/or exterior of buildings and fixtures.

value.name: PLASTERER
value.desc: Plasterer—Applies and repairs plaster in the interior and/or exterior of buildings.

value.name: PLUMBER
value.desc: Plumber—Assembles, installs, and repairs pipes, fittings, and fixtures of heating, water, and drainage systems.

value.name: PRINTER
value.desc: Printer—Makes copies by chemical or photographic means.

value.name: VEHICLE_MECHANIC
value.desc: Vehicle mechanic—Inspects, repairs, and maintains functional parts of mechanical equipment and machinery.

value.name: OPERATIVE
value.desc: Operative—Performs tasks requiring an intermediate level manual skills which can be mastered in a few weeks through limited training to operate machines. This includes bus drivers and vehicle operators.

value.name: BUS_DRIVER
value.desc: Bus driver—Drives a bus used in the service of a school or system.

value.name: OTHER_VEHICLE_OPERATOR
value.desc: Other vehicle operator—Drives a vehicle such as a truck or automobile used in the service of a school or system.

value.name: LABORER
value.desc: Laborer—Performs tasks requiring some manual skills which can be conducted with no special training. This includes individuals performing lifting, digging, mixing, loading, and pulling operations.

value.name: CONSTRUCTION_LABORER
value.desc: Construction laborer—Performs any combination of duties on construction projects, usually working in utility capacity, by transferring from one task to another. Duties include measuring distances from grade stakes, signaling operators of construction equipment, and mixing concrete.

value.name: FREIGHT_STOCK_AND_MATERIALS_
value.desc: Freight, stock, and materials handlers—Loads, unloads, and moves freight, stock, and other materials manually or with equipment that does not require technical skill to operate (e.g., wheel barrows, conveyor belts, etc).

value.name: GARBAGE_COLLECTOR
value.desc: Garbage collector—Collects refuse in designated areas. May drive a truck and operate hoisting device that raises refuse bin into the opening of the truck body.

value.name: GARDENER
value.desc: Gardener—Works a plot of ground where herbs, fruits, flowers, or vegetables are cultivated.

value.name: GROUNDSKEEPER
value.desc: Groundskeeper—Maintains grounds that are owned, rented, or leased and used by a school or system. This does not include the operation of machinery requiring semi -skilled training or experience.

value.name: GARAGE_PARKINGLOT_ATTENDANT
value.desc: Garage/parking-lot attendant—Patrols and monitors parking areas to prevent thefts of and from parked automobiles and collects parking fees from drivers.

value.name: VEHICLE_WASHER_EQUIPMENT_CLEAN
value.desc: Vehicle washer/equipment cleaner—Washes vehicles and equipment with washing and rinsing solutions to remove debris. May manually dislodge debris from objects being washed and dry objects using a cloth or airhose.

value.name: SERVICE_WORK
value.desc: Service work—Performs tasks regardless of level of difficulty which relates to both protective and nonprotective supportive services.

value.name: BUS_MONITOR_CROSSING_GUARD
value.desc: Bus monitor/crossing guard—Helps keep order on buses or other school or system modes of transportation. This includes traffic guards for loading buses, crossing guards for monitoring pedestrian traffic.

value.name: CHILD_CARE_WORKER
value.desc: Child care worker—Assists in implementing child care activities, including custodial functions.

value.name: COOK_FOOD_PREPARER
value.desc: Cook/food preparer—Prepares and cooks foodstuffs in quantities according to menu and number of persons to be served.

value.name: CUSTODIAN
value.desc: Custodian—Performs plant housekeeping and servicing activities consisting of the cleaning; operation of the heating, ventilating, and air-conditioning systems; and the servicing of building equipment.

value.name: DIETARY_TECHNICIAN
value.desc: Dietary technician—Advises and assists personnel in public and private establishments in food services systems by making recommendations for foods that will constitute nutritionally adequate meals.

value.name: ELEVATOR_OPERATOR
value.desc: Elevator operator—Transports passengers and freight between floors of a building via an elevator.

value.name: FACILITIES_MAINTENANCE_WORKER
value.desc: Facilities maintenance worker—Inspects buildings and office areas to evaluate suitability for occupancy considering such factors as air circulation, lighting, location, and size.

value.name: FOOD_SERVER
value.desc: Food server—Serves sandwiches, salads, beverages, desserts and other kinds of food. May order items to replace stocks and collect money for purchases.

value.name: POLICE_OFFICER
value.desc: Police officer—Maintains order, enforces the law, prevents and investigates crime in a school building and its surrounding areas.

value.name: RESIDENT_DORMITORY_SUPERVISOR
value.desc: Resident/dormitory supervisor—Supervises a dormitory or building in which students reside.

value.name: SECURITY_GUARD
value.desc: Security guard—Provides protection to individuals and safeguard the school facility.

value.name: EXTENDED_DAY-CARE_PROVIDER
value.desc: Extended day-care provider—Provides professional day-care services, whether at home or in a center, and who has satisfied any state requirement regarding those services.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The SIF unique identifier for the location.

attribute.name: LocationType
attribute.desc: Defines whether the location is a school or a non-school location.

element.name: LocalId
element.desc: The locally-assigned identifier for this location.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: The state-assigned identifier for this location.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: The ID (GUID) that identifies the district.

element.name: OtherLEAs
element.desc: Other related education agency, such as a regional service agency.

element.name: AddressList
element.desc: This element has the LocationInfo address information.

element.name: LEAInfoRefId
element.desc: The ID (GUID) of an other related education agency, such as a regional service agency.

object.name: ParentLocationInfo
object.desc: A LocationInfo instance could be related to another LocationInfo. This element will help create that relation.

attribute.name: SIF_RefObject
attribute.desc: The name of the object referenced.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID for this transaction. The application that owns this object is responsible for generating this unique ID.

attribute.name: BillingRefId
attribute.desc: A pointer back to the Billing object.

element.name: ReceivedTransactionId
element.desc: Memo transaction ID from other vendor software.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: Type of pay

value.name: PER_PAY
value.desc: Per pay

value.name: PER_DIEM
value.desc: Per diem

value.name: EXTRA
value.desc: Extra pay

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: Transaction GUID for this purchasing activity. The application that owns this object and is responsible for generating this unique ID.

element.name: FiscalYearRefId
element.desc: Reference to fiscal year for the transaction.

element.name: VendorInfoRefId
element.desc: This object references the VendorInfo object and should be considered manditory when FormType="PO"

element.name: LocationInfoRefId
element.desc: The building ID for this purchasing activity.

element.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
element.desc: The employee ID for the originator of this purchasing activity.

value.name: SPECIAL_ID
value.desc: Special Education

value.name: EARLY_INTERVENTION
value.desc: Early Intervention

value.name: INSTITUTIONALIZED
value.desc: Institutionalized Children

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: GUID for this object. The application that owns this object is responsible for generating this unique ID.

element.name: LocationInfoRefId
element.desc: Site where employee actually worked. References LocationInfo object.

element.name: JobFunction
element.desc: The purpose of the activities as related to students.

element.name: RegularHours
element.desc: Regular hours worked. Enter 0 if no hours worked.

element.name: OvertimeHours
element.desc: Overtime hours worked. Enter 0 if no overtime hours worked.

element.name: PayPeriod
element.desc: Pay period hours were worked in.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: Vendor ID.

element.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
element.desc: When the vendor and employee are the same, it may be appropriate to link the EmployeePersonal records to the VendorInfo when tracking expense and tuition reimbursement. This is the GUID of the associated EmployeePersonal object.

element.name: FederalTaxId
element.desc: Taxpayer identification number/Federal tax ID for this vendor.

attribute.name: EmployeePersonalRefId
attribute.desc: This is the GUID that points to the employee represented in the EmployeePersonal object.

element.name: MaritalStatusRate
element.desc: This denotes the current martial status of the employee

element.name: Exempt
element.desc: Is this employee exempt from federal and state exemptions?
